prs.title: Allow caching of IPFS files in file system
prs.truncated_body:
This change adds a variable `GRAPH_IPFS_CACHE_LOCATION`, which, when set, needs to point at a directory writable by `graph-node`. All files that `graph-node` will fetch from IPFS will be cached in that directory so that subsequent requests to fetch these files, e.g., after a restart, will use those cached files rather than issuing another IPFS request.

Caching files has obvious security implica

commits.message: graph: Factor caching of files from IPFS into separate struct
graph: Turn IPFS cache into an enum
graph: Make error checking for EnvVarsMapping possible
graph: Add an environment variable for a file-based IPFS cache
graph: Make IPFS cache methods async
graph: Use ObjectStore for IPFS cache when configured
graph: Move IPFS caching functionality to an IpfsClient

graph: Use caching IPFS clients

Get the settings for CachingClient from the environment

graph: Remove caching from IpfsResolver

Since the IpsClient is now responsible for caching, we shouldn't also cache
in IpfsResolver
graph: Don't panic if the IPFS cache is misconfigured
graph: Allow using redis as an IPFS cache

prs.title: log: support context-logging
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Changes:
- Support the context-logging interface of `slog.Logger`
  - Additionally includes `TraceContext`.
  - Intentionally does not include `CritContext` (crits are discouraged, and we would never want to filter from output based on context)
- Add `WriteCtx` to complement the existing `Write` method
- Allow it to set a default context on the logger, to use in case none i

commits.message:
fork.yaml: document context logging extension

Signed-off-by: protolambda <proto@protolambda.com>
cmd: update logging testdata to match slog

prs.title: ci: Update eest release fix
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

This PR cherry-picks the test/ci changes from upstream to fix CI.
There was some kind of mistake in the EEST release process, and it broke test artifact downloading.

See https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/31880

https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/commit/29a87e442645bc34d08e5c8709c619411c6c3624


Cherry-picked:
```bash
git cherry-pick -S 29a87e442645bc34

commits.message:
build: Update EEST to v4.5.0 (#31880)

We deleted outdated pectra-devnet-6@v1.0.0 release by mistake, so this
PR updates the referenced EEST release to the correct latest version.

@s1na I removed the TODO comment because I think this solves it, unless
it meant something else.

---------

Co-authored-by: MariusVanDerWijden <m.vanderwijden@live.de>

prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Adds a dependency-set CLI flag to op-node.  Currently it is completely optional and unused other than being added to the node Config.

This PR is really just to unblock updating the kurtosis optimism-package so it can set the depset before landing other parts of https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/16042 which will actually start using it and make it a required a

commits.message:
op-node: Add dependency set flag

Required when interop fork is scheduled.
Makes the dependency set available on the node config but it isn't currently used.
Will unblock updating kurtosis to provide the depset config file.
op-node: categorize the dependency set CLI flag

prs.title: [txmgr / batcher] Retry tx submission for blob pool gapped nonce errors
prs.truncated_body:
<!--
Contributions welcome! See https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/.github/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
-->

**Description**

This PR introduces a new "retry interval", and immediately retries (after the interval) tx submission on certain errors (the only one for now is the `nonce too high` error which is returned by geth for gapped nonce blob txs).

**Tests**

Added a new test for this

commits.message: Retry tx submission for gapped nonce errors
Document negative/zero value behavior for CLI flags
Document RetryInterval should be less than ResubmissionTimeout

prs.title: op-deployer: Always generate a dependency set
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

Modify op-deployer to always create a dependency set when deploying that includes all chains being deployed (even if interop is not scheduled).

This matches the upcoming requirement to run op-supervisor and op-node together even without interop being scheduled and op-supervisor requires a dependency set.

Also removes some overly complex code just to log the minimum interop

commits.message: op-deployer: Always generate a dependency set
op-deployer: Skip finding min interop time just for logging.
```

prs.truncated_body:
## Summary

Mark NoResults as a client component

## Rationale

Because we run react compiler in the component library now, all components must be marked as client components.  I forgot to add the marker to this file.

In general we don't need to worry about automating / tooling this as components will be obviously broken if this marker isn't added, but in this case I didn't catch it becau

commits.message: fix(component-library): mark no results page as a client component

prs.title: update npm dependency stellar-sdk for TS bindings
prs.truncated_body:
### What

Update `@stellar/stellar-sdk` npm dependencies to allow anything in the 13.x major version

### Why

So generated TS libraries have the latest & greatest.

When the bindings were new, they needed specific features in specific patch-level updates of js-stellar-sdk. That's no longer true. Anything in the 13.x range will work fine.

commits.message:
update npm dependency stellar-sdk for TS bindings

allow anything in the 13.x major version

also fix some typos and indendation issues in the generated libraries

prs.title: Rebroadcast immediately once a round threshold is met
prs.truncated_body: The original GPBFT protocol dictates that the rebroadcast only gets triggered after the phase timeout has expired. This is reasonable for low number of rounds, where the vast majority of instances finalize within a single round. However, there is an edge-case where when an instance enters more than a few rounds the exponential increase of phase timeout results in extended periods of total radio si

commits.message:
Rebroadcast immediately once a round threshold is met

The original GPBFT protocol dictates that the rebroadcast only gets
triggered after the phase timeout has expired. This is reasonable for
low number of rounds, where the vast majority of instances finalize
within a single round. However, there is an edge-case where when an
instance enters more than a few rounds the exponential increase of phase
timeout results in extended periods of total radio silence.

As a result, the state propagation is hindered greatly, which in turn
increases the chances of the instance taking even longer to finalize.

The changes here introduce a threshold at which rebroadcast is scheduled
without waiting for phase timeout to expire first (defaulting to 3). In
this design, the rebroadcast and successive rebroadcasts work exactly
the same way as dictated in GPBFT design, except the trigger is adjsuted
to consider rounds larger than the threshold as "insufficient progress".

The implementation reverts back to the vanilla GPBFT phase timeout as
the phases progress and resets rebroadcast parameters accordingly

A test is added to assert that when an instance skips to future rounds,
rebroadcast is triggered without wait, and continues to do so after
phase change.

prs.title: tests: put large regression tests behind feature flag
prs.truncated_body:
Put the regression tests for sector sizes > 32KiB behind the `big-tests` feature flag. This way a test run without the flag doesn't need the parameter files for all sector sizes.

For running with the `big-tests` flag, the parameter files for all sector sizes are expected.

commits.message:
tests: put large regression tests behind feature flag

Put the regression tests for sector sizes > 32KiB behind the `big-tests`
feature flag. This way a test run without the flag doesn't need the
parameter files for all sector sizes.

For running with the `big-tests` flag, the parameter files for all sector
sizes are expected.

prs.title: Add caching in EntityIdSingleton
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

Adds per-thread caching using `ContractCallContext` and a configurable buffer to`EntityIdSingleton.get()`
This prevents ID conflicts during entity creation by:

Ensuring consistent IDs within the same flow.
Skipping ahead of recently persisted IDs to avoid collisions.

`EntityIdSingleton.get()` is called twice during single creation flow: once for pending creation and aga

prs.title: feat: expose signable transaction body bytes for HSM signing
prs.truncated_body:
### Description
This PR introduces support for external transaction signing using Hardware Security Modules (HSMs) in the JavaScript SDK. It provides a new API surface to expose canonical `bodyBytes` that are valid for signing, allowing signatures to be generated securely outside the SDK and injected back into the transaction. This feature is essential for enterprise and regulated environments wh

prs.title: Fix DEX keeper_matching unit tests part 3
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

# Reviewers checklist:
- [ ] Try to write more meaningful comments with clear actions to be taken.
- [ ] Nit-picking should be unblocking. Focus on core issues.

# Authors checklist

prs.title: New Dockerfile, New Makefile
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

I do this for a quick set up of NEO-CLI mainnet full node. I restructured the dockerfile and made a Makefile to support. It installed commonly used plugins. If you have any customized requirements such like `testnet` or `install different plugins`, it's easy to modify. It also supports different version between CLI and plugins for test purpose.
